page.title: 15PUPIL PROTEST
page.content: Twelve schoolchildren spent an hour in police cells on the 7th February 1985 after pelting their teachers with eggs.Trouble flared when for the third day running about 250 youngsters stormed out of their classrooms in protest over the teachers pay dispute. The headteacher,Mrs Julia Bevis, called in the police as the childern blocked pavements and chanted slogans The arrested pupils aged between 14 & 16 were locked up until their parents collected them. Three were charged with obstruction the others with causing a breech of the peace.Two others were accused of causing criminal damage at Broomfield Secondry School,in Leigh Park,Hants. . by W.Handyside
